title: Is Aram really random?
body: freaking 5 games in a row already where i and my team get inferior champs in Aram compared to the opposite team. Either by having, good poke team but the enemy would have great cc and mostly tank. Another example would be we became a mostly tank team but we get an outpoking opposite team. This brings me the question is ARAM really random or, some game master is playing with our accounts to have inferior champs?

replies.body:
Wait, you were disadvantaged when you had the poke team because they had a tank team. 
And you were disadvantaged when you had the tank team because they had the poke team? 
Maybe there's more to it? Like skill disparities?
Seems random enough for me, note that there are some accounts who are aram only, and only have the better champs.
This is probably a big part in the ARAM "randomness". Most of my friends that play ARAM have their accounts specifically for the mode.
yes. randomness is not fair. you can flip a coin 1000 times and get tails 1000 times. that doesn't mean the 1001 time is guaranteed to be heads. it's still 50/50.
its random, you gotta remember most people have rerolls and often trade so you can make a quite good team comp.

Nope, its not random by any stretch. I play like 30 different accounts on aram resonably regularly and you get groups of bots (scripts farming IP and XP) moving through the levels up to lev30. If you don't know about these or haven't seen them then just check their items (go out with an Oracles Extract as an initial item against a team with no champs such as Teemo/Twitch/Shaco/etc), how they follow each other or you around the map, how they often run along the bottom of the lane to take the relics when arriving from respawn (every time) and how they all go HAM.... 

These bots almost invariably get the free champs on rotation as they are scripts with no champs owned, so they can only get the frees or maybe Kayle if they got one from RIOT. 

So the 10 champs on free rotation are allocated to them by default as such. Then the players, such as me, with say 10 or 15 other champs owned, say on a lev20 acct, or with 20 or so on a lev25 acct, get the free champs on a far higher ratio than we should. That's why there must be a bias towards the free champs on rotation. There is no other explanation for this.

By way of explanation:

I'd say I get a free champ allocated before any re-roll at least 1 in 2 times when there are 6 or 8 or even 9 other players that are bots and MUST have free champs. So what is the chance of that? There being 1 or 2 or up to 4 free champs available once the bots are allocated a champ each, with what should be a proportionate probability of being my champ (so say 1 out of 16, or 2 out of 17, or even 6 out of 19 - when I am playing with 10 champs I own, usually have more on those accounts). 

How can this possibly deliver a 1 in 2 chance of a free champ landing for me? Unless the ARAM server allocates the champs in order with mine being allocated first? Which is not totally random, as the odds seem to be some form of "prior odds" not absolute 1 in X probability where X is the number of champs available to my account. I need to revise my Bayesian Stats to get the head around that but it does not make sense that I should land free champs from the rotation so often especially when the other players in the game who are bots must get free champs, thereby reducing the odds of landing a free champ.

Im not sure but there might be something to balance out the teams 
all i know is that there's a higher chance of getting champs on free week
I think every certain day there's a poll and like let's say 10 champs. Each dday u play aram u get 1 of 10 in the pool. I mean it's just my thought I don't really think it's random at all.

On a different note. I find myself with a pool of 5 - 10 champs that i get 3-4 times  a week, every week. Then my favourite champs I'm lucky to get once every 3 months (then someone dodges and I'm tilted before I even get into the game)

Because teams don't go in your favour it's not random?

Ok.
